result.execSummary:
The defendant Donnell D Miles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Must not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care as well as domestic batterers intervention and anger management. Body armor warning. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Conditions as in Cts 2 & 4

Defendant Donnell D Miles in court with attorney Erin J. Preston.  Defendant Donnell D Miles in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have received and reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. 

BTC: Ct 2 - Total sentence is 5 yrs WPS bifurcated as 3 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES
         Ct 4 - Total sentence is 2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES consec to Ct 2
         Ct 7 & 8 - Sent w/held - 3 yrs prob conc to each other but consec to Cts 2 & 4

Dirk Jensen
Preliminary hearing at 11-05-2015 08:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  No contact with the victims, LMJ and BJS (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Donnell D Miles in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Donnell D Miles in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
